etymology.description: Depicts a plate or flat dish -> borrowed for abstract meanings -> unrelated to 几(幾) (jī, 'small table')
etymology.interpretation: 凡(凡) (fán, 'ordinary') originally depicted a flat dish or plate. Over time, it expanded to encompass broader abstract meanings and is unrelated to the character 几(幾) which represents a small table.

examples.chinese: 他是个平凡的人(他是個平凡的人)。
examples.pinyin: tā shì gè píngfán de rén.

examples.chinese: 凡人都可能犯错(凡人都可能犯錯)，从错误中成长(從錯誤中成長)。
examples.pinyin: fán rén dōu kěnéng fàncuò, cóng cuòwù zhōng chéngzhǎng.
examples.english: Ordinary people may make mistakes, and grow from them.

examples.chinese: 他凡去旅行(他凡去旅行)，总能发现新的风景(總能發現新的風景)。
examples.pinyin: tā fán qù lǚxíng, zǒng néng fāxiàn xīn de fēngjǐng.
examples.english: Whenever he travels, he always discovers new sceneries.
